intro: Brachypterum submontanum, commonly known as the dwarf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is typical of the Malvaceae family. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed areas. Brachypterum submontanum is adapted to thrive in warm, dry climates and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
